Package gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc

Class CorsResponseFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc.CorsResponseFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jakarta.ws.rs.container.ContainerResponseFilter
    @Provider
public class CorsResponseFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements jakarta.ws.rs.container.ContainerResponseFilter
    This class implements a JAX-RS Jersey ContainerResponseFilter that allows Jersey implemented web services to support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing(CORS). As of Jersey 2.0, Jersey does not have any built-in support for CORS. While it is possible to explicitly add the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header in the response created by each HTTP operation (e.g., GET, POST, etc.), Jersey's default OPTIONS implementation does not implement CORS. And while the W3C's April 2012 CORS specification states that a preflight (OPTIONS) request is not required before a simple operation (GET, HEAD, POST), Safari 5 and Firefox 15 do send preflight request before allowing a POST. Given current browsers' preflight requirements and the otherwise repetative code required in each operation's implementation, supporting CORS in web services implemented with Jersey by using this class seems like the best approach at this time.

    • Field Detail

      • APPROVED_HDRS

        private static final java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> APPROVED_HDRS
        HTTP request headers that we will allow the client to use. Note that we must allow case-insensitive matches because, as of 11/2017, at lease Chrome and Firefox send the lower-case value of HttpHeaders.CONTENT_TYPE and expect that we will allow it.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public void filter​(jakarta.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext requestContext,
                   jakarta.ws.rs.container.ContainerResponseContext responseContext)
        Filter method called after a response has been provided for a request (either by a request filter or by a matched resource method). Filters in the filter chain are ordered according to their jakarta.annotation.Priority class-level annotation value.
        Specified by:
        filter in interface jakarta.ws.rs.container.ContainerResponseFilter
        Parameters:
        requestContext - request context.
        responseContext - response context.

      • approvedRequestHeaders

        private java.lang.String approvedRequestHeaders​(java.lang.String requestedHeaders)
        Returns a subset of the given HTTP request headers that we will allow a client to use.
        Parameters:
        requestedHeaders - comma separated list of HTTP request headers that the client want approval to use.
        Returns:
        String containing a comma separated subset of the given HTTP request headers that we will allow a client to use.
